metadata.title: Module registry protocol reference
metadata.description: Terraform discovers modules available for installation using the module registry protocol. Learn about the module registry protocol so consumers can find your modules.

outlineItems.title: List Available Versions for a Specific Module
Download Source Code for a Specific Module Version

Prior versions do not support this protocol.`)),mdx("h2",{"id":"introduction"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#introduction","aria-label":"introduction permalink"},`\xbb`),`Introduction`),mdx("p",null,`The Terraform CLI uses the module registry protocol to discover metadata
about modules available for installation and to locate the distribution
package for a selected module.`),mdx("p",null,`The primary implementation of this protocol is the public
`,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://registry.terraform.io/"},`Terraform Registry`),` at `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`registry.terraform.io`),`.
By writing and deploying your own implementation of this protocol, you can
create a separate registry to distribute your own modules, as an alternative to
publishing them on the public Terraform Registry.`),mdx("p",null,`The public Terraform Registry implements a superset of the API described on
this page, in order to capture additional information used in the registry UI.
For information on those extensions, see
`,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"/terraform/registry/api-docs"},`Terraform Registry HTTP API`),`. Third-party registry
implementations may choose to implement those extensions if desired, but
Terraform CLI itself does not use them.`),mdx("h2",{"id":"module-addresses"},mdx("a",{parentName:"h2","className":"__permalink-h","href":"#module-addresses","aria-label":"module addresses permalink"},`\xbb`),`Module Addresses`),mdx("p",null,`Each Terraform module has an associated address. A module address has the
syntax `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`hostname/namespace/name/system`),`, where:`),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("a",{parentName:"li","id":"hostname","className":"__target-lic","aria-hidden":"true"}),mdx("a",{parentName:"li","href":"#hostname","aria-label":"hostname permalink","className":"__permalink-lic"},mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`hostname`)),` is the hostname of the module registry that serves this module.`),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("a",{parentName:"li","id":"namespace","className":"__target-lic","aria-hidden":"true"}),mdx("a",{parentName:"li","href":"#namespace","aria-label":"namespace permalink","className":"__permalink-lic"},mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`namespace`)),` is the name of a namespace, unique on a particular hostname, that
can contain one or more modules that are somehow related. On the public
Terraform Registry the "namespace" represents the organization that is
packaging and distributing the module.`),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("a",{parentName:"li","id":"name","className":"__target-lic","aria-hidden":"true"}),mdx("a",{parentName:"li","href":"#name","aria-label":"name permalink","className":"__permalink-lic"},mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`name`)),` is the module name, which generally names the abstraction that the
module is intending to create.`),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("a",{parentName:"li","id":"system","className":"__target-lic","aria-hidden":"true"}),mdx("a",{parentName:"li","href":"#system","aria-label":"system permalink","className":"__permalink-lic"},mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`system`)),` is the name of a remote system that the module is primarily written
to target. For multi-cloud abstractions, there can be multiple modules with
addresses that differ only in "system" to reflect provider-specific
implementations of the abstraction, like
`,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},`registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/consul/aws`),` vs.
`,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},`registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/consul/azurerm`),`. The system name commonly
matches the type portion of the address of an official provider, like `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},`aws`),`
or `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},`azurerm`),` in the above examples, but that is not required and so you can
use whichever system keywords make sense for the organization of your
particular registry.`)),mdx("p",null,`The `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`hostname/`),` portion of a module address (including its slash delimiter)
is optional, and if omitted defaults to `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`registry.terraform.io/`),`.`),mdx("p",null,`For example:`),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("a",{parentName:"li","id":"hashicorp-consul-aws","className":"__target-lic","aria-hidden":"true"}),mdx("a",{parentName:"li","href":"#hashicorp-consul-aws","aria-label":"hashicorp consul aws permalink","className":"__permalink-lic"},mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`hashicorp/consul/aws`)),` is a shorthand for
`,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"li"},`registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/consul/aws`),`, which is a module on the
public registry for deploying Consul clusters in Amazon Web Services.`),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},mdx("a",{parentName:"li","id":"example-com-awesomecorp-consul-happycloud","className":"__target-lic","aria-hidden":"true"}),mdx("a",{parentName:"li","href":"#example-com-awesomecorp-consul-happycloud","aria-label":"example com awesomecorp consul happycloud permalink","className":"__permalink-lic"},mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"a"},`example.com/awesomecorp/consul/happycloud`)),` is a hypothetical module published
on a third-party registry.`)),mdx("p",null,`If you intend to share a module you've developed for use by all Terraform
users, please consider publishing it into the public
`,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://registry.terraform.io/"},`Terraform Registry`),` to make your module more

follow the `,mdx("a",{parentName:"p","href":"https://semver.org/"},`Semantic Versioning 2.0`),` conventions, with

`)),mdx("p",null,`If the given URL is a relative URL then Terraform will interpret it as relative

module version's source can be downloaded in the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`X-Terraform-Get`),` header.
The value of this header accepts the same values as the `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`source`),` argument
in a `,mdx("inlineCode",{parentName:"p"},`module`),` block in Terraform configuration, as described in

alertBanner.text: Terraform Cloud is now HCP Terraform
